identified-content.object.title: NEW YORK TIMES BOOK OF SCIENCE, THE (BOOK)

block.p: THE NEW YORK TIMES BOOK OF SCIENCE LITERACY: What Everyone Needs to Know From Newton to the Knuckleball. By the editors and reporters of Science Times. Edited by Richard Flaste. (Times Books/Random House, $24.95). The 120 or so articles in this collection by the staff of Science Times, the weekly science news section of The New York Times, have helped the public wrestle with current issues from passive smoking and disappearing beaches to the greenhouse effect and the perils (if any) of radiation from power lines. Gathered together by Richard Flaste, formerly the editor in charge of Science Times, they convey a view of science not as a mumbo jumbo of specialists or a collection of disciplines but as a sophisticated and perfectly accessible way of thinking whose importance to nonscientists is greater than ever, and unlikely to diminish.
